## Quick start

### Before you begin

You will need to have a Mendable Search credientials. If you don't have one, you can get one by going to [mendable.ai](https://mendable.ai/) and signing up for free.

### What is Mendable?

Mendable provides chat-powered search through [components](https://docs.mendable.ai/components/overview). It allows you to provide detailed, accurate, and contextually relevant answers to your customers' questions based on your documentation. Mendable also offers an [API](https://docs.mendable.ai/mendable-api/overview) where it can be used to integrate Mendable's ingestion and completion capabilities into your own applications.

### Installation

If you are not using React, you can use our [Vanilla JS](https://docs.mendable.ai/components/vanilla-js) component or our [API](https://docs.mendable.ai/mendable-api/overview).

```
npm install @mendable/search

```

### Usage

In your React app, import the component and pass in the `anon_key` prop. You can find your `anon_key` in the Mendable [project dashboard](https://mendable.ai/app).

```
import { MendableSearchBar } from "@mendable/search"

<MendableSearchBar anon_key='YOUR_ANON_KEY'/>

```

### Component

In this example it will display our [search bar](https://docs.mendable.ai/components/search-bar) component.

![](https://docs.mendable.ai/images/search-bar.png)

### AI Search

When clicked, it displays the AI search modal, where the user can ask questions.

![](https://docs.mendable.ai/images/search-borderless.png)

That's it! You now have Mendable Search set up in your React project. Take a look at our other components and their properties [here](https://docs.mendable.ai/components/overview).

If you want to build on top of Mendable's infrastructure, check out our [API](https://docs.mendable.ai/mendable-api/overview).

Last but not least, we offer many [examples](https://docs.mendable.ai/examples) and integrations ( [Docusaurus](https://docs.mendable.ai/integrations/docusaurus), [Python SDK](https://docs.mendable.ai/sdks/python)) for you to get started quickly.
